meanings.definition: To combine or merge into a single unit
meanings.sent1: I will consolidate all the data into one report.
meanings.sent2: She decided to consolidate her savings into one account.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to consolidate all the rabbits into a single hat.
meanings.sent4: His speech managed to consolidate the diverse audience into a unified group.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces finally consolidate into a complete picture.

meanings.definition: To make stronger or more solid
meanings.sent1: Adding more cement will consolidate the foundation.
meanings.sent2: The treaty aims to consolidate the alliance between the two countries.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers consolidate when he wears his special cape.
meanings.sent4: Her determination helped consolidate her resolve to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret ingredient will consolidate the flavors in the dish.

meanings.definition: To bring together into a single whole
meanings.sent1: The merger will consolidate the two companies into one.
meanings.sent2: Let's consolidate all the feedback into a comprehensive report.
meanings.sent3: The students tried to consolidate their ideas into a coherent presentation.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes consolidate the colors into a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The conductor's skillful direction will consolidate the orchestra's performance.
